author: gifford tallmadge
comment: After latest update (06-03-2017) lost all of my readings and history. Forced me to set up as new user. Lost several months of readings. Please fix. While I did have the datbase backed up..currently there is no way to import it back.

author: Tudor Sturzoiu
comment: Simple, functional, and beautiful. It tracks a handful of your most important health metrics and keeps them all in one place. The graphs are great and the interface is intuitive. It doesn't do calorie/carb counting like a few of the other apps, but that's actually a big plus for me, since I use other apps to do that, and prefer an uncluttered interface for simple tracking.

author: Jonathan Green
comment: Can't put in 4.3 a a result. Always says invalid number. Works for 4 or 5. Can't use this for mmol/L at all.

I'm new to diabetes.  I'm new to the App,  I've had it about 4 days now.  Can someone tell me what I'm doing wrong or is it the App?  I wish I could give this 5 stars.  I like everything about it but this problem below.  I use the weight data entry option.  Pretty simple, settings are on pounds and indicate pounds in the results.  But no matter what I enter it saves the numbers right in History but displays the graph results wrong by hundreds of pounds.     The entry cell for weight entries always reads exactly what I enter, then I save it the same way I do my glucose reading.  The Graph and History are not even close to what I entered.  My weight on the graph  goes from the 300's to the 100's one day after the next randomly.  That would imply I lost 200 pounds overnight.  I go into History and look at the entry and even edit it despite it being the number I originally entered.  When I edit it and save it, the saved number is +/- 5-7 pounds.  Then when I look at the graph it shows me in the 100 pound range.  I'm in the mid 200's.  Point is, none of the numbers match the entry.  Edited numbers always save wrong.  Does someone have a similar experience and or solution?

author: Lisa San Miguel
comment: Very pleased with this app. Android user. One month of use. Wonderful app. Thank you!
It's really great, just couldn't give a 5star since graph sometimes drops to 0 on some days instead of going to next reading.

author: Kiran Vedak
comment: Simple yet useful.

author: Michael Speyer
comment: Best, properly FREE glucose app out there at the moment! Crashes on android wear but hopefully devs will look into this. LOVE that it does NOT require you to join some social group or give away all your details or data. Google drive integration is simply awesome!

author: Alan Raczek
comment: Lot's of great features. I love the graph and the Android Wear support.  Suggestion: Custom meal time ranges (For ex. I could change "Before breakfast" to be within the time range of 7am-noon if I wanted). With my schedule I eat meals later than average and I have to change the meal in Glucosio every time I input data.

I have been looking for an app such as this one for a while, and all I've gotta say is great job to Glucosio. All of you have done an amazing job at creating a friendly app for diabetics that makes us all feel motivated to keep comsistant b/s readings. Thank y'all!!

author: Shaheed Mohamed
comment: App works nicely and is simple to use. Export feature is great. Needs to have ability to use decimal in the weight field when using KG. Lost one star because of that.....😟
title: Nice app, except for decimal

author: Mike O'Lear
comment: Easy to use, and very useful features.  Thank you!

author: Hamish Robinson
comment: Only reads Libre sensor in mg instead of mmol???

author: Jed Dye
comment: can't input wieght in Kgs as can't add a dot (example for 74.3Kgs). Can only input either 74 or 743kgs!!!!!

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: We will look into adding support for this in a future release

author: User Linux
comment: I wish it was possible to disable to dip to zero if there is a longer pause between tests.  Would be nice if the 'export / backup' could change name to 'backup / restore' and that you could choose to select export directory before doing a backup.  Export to own cloud would be nice too.

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback we will take it into consideration for our future releases. Feedback like this helps us continue to improve the app!

title: Quite OK, but miss some few things

author: Larry Buldak
comment: Using 4 months now w/daily data. Though still buggy, gonna be great diabetes app. Really need bluetooth updates from meter.

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Thanks, we're working hard to improve Glucosio every day.

title: Getting better

author: Russ Peters
comment: No value to me.

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Hey, can you try again with latest release? Some devices have restrictive permissions that don't allow us to export data.

title: No selection for file import

author: Priva Stole
comment: With the latest update it keeps crashing. Worked excellent until now. Please advise. I removed and added it again and it will not open at all.    ADDENDUM: The update worked! Thank you very much. I am grateful and will load the info back in.

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Thank you and sorry for the inconvenience

title: Crashing: Issue Resolved

author: Jackie Salvadore-Ally
comment: There is no option for me to select 'update'. It has 'uninstall' or 'open'. It has to have the 'update" button for me to do that. Please ensure that that button is there for customers. Thank you for your understanding in this matter. Kind regards.

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Hey Jackie, updates are managed by Google Play, so it's not a problem on our side. Can you check if latest version of Glucosio works well?

title: Not working

author: Siva Machina
comment: It crashes everytime I try to open the app. I am on a Samsung Galaxy Light useing Android 4.4.2

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: This should be resolved in an update released today. Please update the app using Google Play.

title: Crashing

author: Brian Rodriguez
comment: Keep getting a -505 error when trying to install. I have contacted Google Play support, they claim it is an error with the App and pointed me to you.  5/8/16 Edit: I have it installed but what can I do with it? I have data I've exported from my CGMS and Pump. Can I import into Glucosio and have it show me data? Is there a manual for the app? How is this better than what I already have?

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: This is not really the appropriate place for support our app has a support option and there is a support option on the Google Play link if you would like to reach out we can connect you with someone from our support team.

author: Mr neelam nagarajeswararao
comment: To maintain my Diabetic profile - a comprehensive App !  Every Diabetic should've this App !  Thank you ... Sirs !

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Thank you!

title: Superb !

author: Anita Thommes
comment: Easy to use. Have yet to figure out how to edit, to go back.

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: We are adding an edit function hopefully in our next release in a couple weeks! We are glad you like the ease of use!

title: It's ok

author: Steven Greenstein
comment: Phenomenal application for total and complete management and historical data of Diabetes and glucose levels. for Type 1 and/or Type 2 patients.  Best way to earn 5 star rating would be means or synchronizing data across multiple devices and platforms, e.g. Microsoft Windows p.c. or Android/iOS smartphones or the ability to password protect data / historical data in the cloud to sync/import or retrieve lost data in event of lost, stolen or factory reset Android smartphone.

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content:
Hi Steven,
Cloud sync is coming it's been on our roadmap and we're just waiting on a bug fix in the database we use to allow us to implement it.

title: GREAT APPLICATION FOR DIABETES MANAGEMENT

author: Daniel W. Nagala
comment: Nice app. Helpful for tracking one's periodic readings.

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Thanks!

author: Ryan Grange
comment: Only feature I'd like to see is import for when you switch devices.

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: We hope to have import in our next release

title: relatively simple tracking

author: Janet Hilbert
comment: Almost brilliant in its simple elegant utility

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Thank you!

title: Simple. Works.

author: Mark O'Sullivan
comment: Fantastic work done here. All open source and all for a great cause. Delighted to see that there's support for Android Wear as well!

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: We are excited you are enjoying it!

author: Matteo Cartuccia
comment: On Android 6.0.1 after the latest update it crashes while on background. It happens mostly while using Whatsapp.

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content:
Hi Mario,
we've already patched the issue and submitted an update. You'll receive it in the next 2-3 hours.
EDIT: The fix should be live now. Can you confirm?

Sorry for the inconvenience.

title: Keep crashing after last update

author: Paul Valley
comment: good job on this glad to see a opensource app for diabetis you should add blood presure and pulse as well seeing as they go hand in hand also needs to be able to export charts

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Blood Pressure, Cholesterol and other metrics are now available in latest release. Have fun!

author: Claude Monecel
comment: After 7 days i have now uninstalled it's to buggy

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content:
Hi Claude! We're working hard to push next Glucosio version with data export and new metrics as soon as possible.
Thanks for your review.

title: OnTrack user

author: Karely Perez
comment: This app is so easy to use and track my sugar levels, awesome job

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Thanks!

author: Asa Dotzler
comment: A clean and attractive app that makes recording and tracking a breeze. Looking forward to sharing Glucosio with diabetic friends and family.

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Thanks!

author: Fabio Marconi
comment: Thanks guys

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Thank you!

title: Usefull app

author: Jenniffer Zogg
comment: Excellent design and easy to use!

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Thanks!

author: Pizzaman Hall
comment: Good app to keep track but a few bugs...you cant use a decimal, some of the numbers change like the weight...im 274 lbs but the app keeps saying 273, the export doesnt show the date. It shows ##### in the date field. Otherwise, its decent.

Really needs cloud coverage between devices. I use phone, tablet to record 1a and laptop. If i enter on tablet, sould show up on my phone also to keep in sync;vice versa. Got new Note 7 and history is history, gone. UGLY. Have to use tablet in Dr. Instead of phone.

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Hey, did you try Glucosio's backup tool? It allows to sync all data on Google Drive and download it on all your devices.

title: Like it

author: Osama Asif
comment: My mother is diabetic, gonna share it with her! Awesome work!

reply.author: Glucosio
reply.content: Thanks!

author: Rajiv Daga
comment: This app should have an option to have multiple profiles to track other family members....

author: Jeton kukalaj
comment: Bella, funzionale e costruita bene. Grande!
